...
# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Abstract


People have a greater desire to date highly attractive partners, which induces
intrasexual competition between same-sex individuals. The present study used
functional magnetic resonance imaging to explore whether and how intrasexual
competition modulates pain empathy for a same-sex rival and the underlying neural
mechanism. Participants were scanned while processing the pain of a same-sex ‘lucky
guy’ who had an attractive partner and one with a plain partner. The results
revealed that participants reported lower pain intensity for the lucky guy.
Neurally, reduced pain-related activations in anterior insula and anterior mid-cingulate
cortex and increased activations in right superior frontal gyrus (SFG) and
medial prefrontal gyrus (MPFC) were found for the lucky guy compared to the one with
a plain partner. Right SFG and MPFC activations could predict participants’
subsequent pain intensity ratings for the lucky guy. These findings suggest
...

...
# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Abstract
...
intrasexual competition can modulate normal empathic responses.

 
Keywords: pain empathy, intrasexual competition, fMRI, AI, aMCC, MPFC

...

# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Introduction


Evolutionarily speaking, physical attractiveness is linked to youth, health, and
female fertility ([Sugiyama](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B32), [2005](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B32)). Physical attractiveness also provides information about mate-relevant
economic or social factors, such as income or hunting ability ([Harper, 2000](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B21)) and plays an important role in mate selection ([Grammer et al., 2003](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B16); [Gangestad and Scheyd, 2005](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B15)). Both males and females have a greater desire to date highly attractive
...

##  Introduction
...
partners ([Greitemeyer, 2010](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B17)). The common motive to obtain and maintain access to partners, especially
highly desirable partners, can often induce intrasexual competition ([Buunk and Massar, 2012](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B3)). Emerging evidence has demonstrated that intrasexual competition can affect
people’s attitudes. That is, people tend to dislike same-sex rivals, exhibiting
negative evaluations and hostile behaviors toward them ([Fisher, 2004](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B13); [Griskevicius et al., 2009](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B18)). Previous studies have revealed that the attitudes held toward others impact

especially when the rival is a ‘lucky guy’ who obtains the love of a highly
attractive partner, modulated by intrasexual competition? The goal of the present study
was to investigate the impact of intrasexual competition on empathy and the

Although, a key feature of empathy is the observer’s experience of an affective
state that is isomorphic to another person’s affective state, empathy is not

targets for contracting AIDS from illegal intravenous drug use, the less empathy
participants had for the target’s pain, indicating that empathic responses were

##  Introduction

responses to their pain.

pictures showing PlainPlain or PlainAtt (targets were always the same-sex as the

level, decreased pain-related brain activations in AI and ACC/aMCC and increased
activation in MPFC, which has been associated with the regulation of empathic pain,
would be observed for PlainAtt relative to PlainPlain.

# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Meterials And Methods

 
### Participants


Twenty right-handed participants (12 females, mean age = 21.70, SD = 1.89) were recruited from the university community to participate in this
experiment. None of the participants had a history of neurological or psychiatric
disorders. All participants received monetary compensation for their
participation. All of them had normal or corrected-to-normal vision. All participants gave
informed consent before scanning. The study was approved by the local ethics
committee.

 
...

...
# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Meterials And Methods
...
### Materials


A total of 192 pictures collected from two females and two males volunteers were
used as stimuli. For each volunteer, 24 painful pictures, depicting their
bilateral ears (not including faces), palms, and index fingers in four kinds of
nociceptive situations (cutting with a knife or a pair of scissors and pricking with
a needle or an awl), were paired with a corresponding non-painful situation, in
which the nociceptive tool did not touch the ear, palm, or finger, but was
placed next to the body part (in total, 48 pictures for each volunteer). All of the
pictures were 500 × 350 pixels in size. Ninety-six pictures from the two males
volunteers were used as stimuli for male participants, while ninety-six other
pictures from the two females volunteers were used as stimuli for female
participants.

 
...

...
# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Meterials And Methods
...
### Procedure


Before the experiment, we collected 38 free face pictures (19 females and 19
males) from the Internet. From 19 females candidates, one attractive female model
and two plain females models were selected according to the attractiveness and
liking ratings of 10 males (not participants). The attractive model got the
highest attractiveness and liking ratings, while the two plain models were ranked in
the last quarter of the ratings. There were significant differences between the
attractiveness and liking ratings of the attractive model and the plain models (ts > 3.46, ps < 0.01), but no significant attractiveness or liking rating differences
between the two plain models. From 19 male candidates, one attractive male model and
two plain male models were selected in the same way, with significant differences
...

...
# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Meterials And Methods
...
### Procedure
...
between the attractive model and plain models (ts > 6.20, ps < 0.01) and no significant differences between the two plain models. For each
participant, face pictures of two couples were presented during the fMRI scan.

Imaging was performed on a 3T Siemens Trio system (East China Normal University,
Shanghai) with a standard head coil. Functional images were obtained using a
gradient echo echo-planar imaging (GRE-EPI) sequence. Thirty-five transversal
slices with 3 mm slice thickness and a 0.3-mm spatial gap were acquired (TR = 2200 ms, TE = 30 ms, FOV = 220 mm, flip angle = 90°, matrix size = 64 × 64). There was only one run of
functional scanning which was about 13 min (346° EPI volumes). Before the
functional imaging, a high-resolution structural image was acquired using a
T1-weighted, multiplanar reconstruction sequence (MPR; 1 mm× 1 mm× 1 mm).

# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Discussion


The present study investigated how the empathic responses were modulated by
intrasexual competition. Results showed that, at the behavioral level, participants
reported less liking, lower empathic pain intensity, and higher envy for
PlainAtt, the lucky guy with an attractive partner, than PlainPlain, the one with a
plain partner. At the neural level, increased activations in AI and aMCC were
observed in the painful situations relative to the non-painful situations. More
importantly, decreased pain-related AI and aMCC activations and stronger MPFC and
right SFG activations were found for PlainAtt than for PlainPlain, indicating
behavioral and neural empathic responses to others’ pain were modulated by
intrasexual competition.


Anterior insula and ACC/aMCC have been considered to be involved in encoding the
affective dimension of first-hand pain and to play a key role in empathy for
...

...

others’ pain ([Singer et al., 2004](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B30)). In the present study, AI and aMCC responded more strongly to the painful
relative to the non-painful stimuli, which was consistent with the findings of
previous studies that these areas were critically involved in empathic pain
processing ([Fan et al., 2011](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B11); [Lamm et al., 2011](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B24)). Furthermore, it has been shown that empathic neural responses in AI and aMCC

For example, a recent study found that social hierarchies established based
on incidental skill in a perceptual task affected AI and aMCC activations during
empathy for pain. Specifically, empathic brain activations in AI and aMCC were
reduced when responding to the pain of superior-status targets relative to that

of inferior-status targets ([Feng et al., 2016](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B12)). Interestingly, our data revealed that AI and aMCC were also involved in the
modulation of pain empathy by intrasexual competition. Compared with the guy with
a plain partner, when participants saw the lucky guy suffering pain, reduced AI
and aMCC activations and lower pain intensity ratings were observed, indicating
that the normal empathic response for the lucky guy was suppressed. It should
be noted that, accompanying the decrease of empathic responses, participants
reported more negative attitudes (i.e., less liking and higher envy) toward the
lucky guy, suggesting that intrasexual competition altered their attitudes, which
might have affected the empathy for others’ pain. This converging evidence may
indicate that AI and aMCC activities are not just responsible for automatic

and social hierarchies.


Interestingly, the present study also found greater activation in MPFC for

important role in cognitive inhibitory control and emotion regulation ([Floden and Stuss, 2006](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B14); [Banks et al., 2007](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B2); [Phillips et al., 2008](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B25)). ##  Discussion
...
analyses showed that when participants saw the lucky guy in pain, stronger
activation in MPFC was observed and lower pain intensity ratings were reported,
providing support for the argument that MPFC was associated with the evaluation of
others’ physical pain. Additionally, we also found that MPFC activation in the
present study was accompanied by activity in right SFG. In addition to MPFC activity, [Cheng et al. (2007)](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427/#B5) also observed increased right SFG activation and negative functional
connectivity between right SFG and AI when physicians (versus controls) viewed painful
stimuli. In the present study, right SFG was more active while processing the
painful stimuli for the lucky guy and its activation predicted participants’ pain
intensity ratings for the lucky guy. This evidence suggests that right SFG may have
a similar function to MPFC in evaluating others’ physical pain.

# Decreased Empathic Responses to the ‘Lucky Guy’ in Love: The Effect of Intrasexual Competition
...
##  Discussion
...
The present study used fMRI to explore pain empathy for the lucky guy in love.
The results revealed that individuals had more negative attitudes and reported
lower pain intensity for the lucky guy with an attractive partner compared to the
one with a plain partner. Neurally, reduced responses in AI and aMCC and
increased activations in MPFC and right SFG were observed for the pain of the lucky guy
compared to the one with a plain partner. These findings indicate intrasexual
competition can affect attitudes toward same-sex rivals and modulate normal
empathic responses to their suffering.

from pathlib import Path",
                "import requests",
                "",
                "URL = \"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=%28%28love%5BTitle%2FAbstract%5D%29+AND+%28fmri%5BTitle%2FAbstract%5D%29%29+AND+%28%22Front+Psychol.%22%5BJournal%5D%29+NOT+%28Editorial%29&filter=datesearch.y_10\"",
                "",
                "# Set browser-like headers to avoid being blocked by the site",
                "headers = {",
                "    \"User-Agent\": (",
                "        \"Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) \"",
                "        \"AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) \"",
                "        \"Chrome/125.0.0.0 Safari/537.36\"",
                "    ),",
                "    \"Accept-Language\": \"en-US,en;q=0.9\",",
                "    \"Referer\": \"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/\",",
                "}",
                "",
                "outfile = Path(",
                "    f\"front_psychol_fmri_love.html\"",
                ")",
                "",
                "with requests.Session() as s:",
                "    s.headers.update(headers)",
                "    resp = s.get(URL, timeout=30)",
                "    resp.raise_for_status()           # raise an error for non-200 responses",
                "    # Use server-provided encoding when available; default to utf-8",
                "    if not resp.encoding:",
                "        resp.encoding = \"utf-8\"",
                "    outfile.write_text(resp.text, encoding=resp.encoding)",
                "",
                "print(f\"Saved {outfile.resolve()} ({outfile.stat().st_size:,} bytes)\")

from pathlib import Path",
                "import requests",
                "",
                "URL = \"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?term=%28%28love%5BTitle%2FAbstract%5D%29+AND+%28fmri%5BTitle%2FAbstract%5D%29%29+AND+%28%22Front+Psychol.%22%5BJournal%5D%29+NOT+%28Editorial%29&filter=datesearch.y_10\"",
                "",
                "# Set browser-like headers to avoid being blocked by the site",
                "headers = {",
                "    \"User-Agent\": (",
                "        \"Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) \"",
                "        \"AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) \"",
                "        \"Chrome/125.0.0.0 Safari/537.36\"",
                "    ),",
                "    \"Accept-Language\": \"en-US,en;q=0.9\",",
                "    \"Referer\": \"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/\",",
                "}",
                "",
                "outfile = Path(",
                "    f\"front_psychol_fmri_love.html\"",
                ")",
                "",
                "with requests.Session() as s:",
                "    s.headers.update(headers)",
                "    resp = s.get(URL, timeout=30)",
                "    resp.raise_for_status()           # raise an error for non-200 responses",
                "    # Use server-provided encoding when available; default to utf-8",
                "    if not resp.encoding:",
                "        resp.encoding = \"utf-8\"",
                "    outfile.write_text(resp.text, encoding=resp.encoding)",
                "",
                "print(f\"Saved {outfile.resolve()} ({outfile.stat().st_size:,} bytes)\")

+from pathlib import Path
+import requests
+
+# List of PMC article URLs to download
+urls = [
+    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427",
+    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7223160",
+    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7264388",
+]
+
+# Set browser-like headers to avoid being blocked by the site
+headers = {
+    "User-Agent": (
+        "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) "
+        "AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) "
+        "Chrome/125.0.0.0 Safari/537.36"
+    ),
+    "Accept-Language": "en-US,en;q=0.9",
+    "Referer": "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/",
+}
+
+for url in urls:
+    pmcid = url.split("/")[-1]
+    outfile = Path(f"{pmcid}.html")
+    with requests.Session() as s:
+        s.headers.update(headers)
+        resp = s.get(url, timeout=30)
+        resp.raise_for_status()           # raise an error for non-200 responses
+        # Use server-provided encoding when available; default to utf-8
+        if not resp.encoding:
+            resp.encoding = "utf-8"
+        outfile.write_text(resp.text, encoding=resp.encoding)
+    print(f"Saved {outfile.resolve()} ({outfile.stat().st_size:,} bytes)")

You should replace the single URL and output file with a loop over your three article URLs, saving each HTML file separately. Here’s how you can update your code block:

```python
from pathlib import Path
import requests

# List of PMC article URLs
urls = [
    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427",
    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7223160",
    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7264388",
]

headers = {
    "User-Agent": (
        "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) "
        "AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) "
        "Chrome/125.0.0.0 Safari/537.36"
    ),
    "Accept-Language": "en-US,en;q=0.9",
    "Referer": "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/",
}

for url in urls:
    pmcid = url.split("/")[-1]
    outfile = Path(f"{pmcid}.html")
    with requests.Session() as s:
        s.headers.update(headers)
        resp = s.get(url, timeout=30)
        resp.raise_for_status()
        if not resp.encoding:
            resp.encoding = "utf-8"
        outfile.write_text(resp.text, encoding=resp.encoding)
    print(f"Saved {outfile.resolve()} ({outfile.stat().st_size:,} bytes)")
```

This will download and save each article as `PMC4863427.html`, `PMC7223160.html`, and `PMC7264388.html`.

    print(f"Saved {outfile.resolve()} ({outfile.stat().st_size:,} bytes)")

import requests

# List of PMC article URLs
urls = [

    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7223160",

]

headers = {

    ),
    "Accept-Language": "en-US,en;q=0.9",
    "Referer": "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/",
}

for url in urls:

    outfile = Path(f"{pmcid}.html")

edit.text:
# Extract coordinates and metadata from the three PMC HTML files and save to CSV
import re
import pandas as pd
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from pathlib import Path

# List of HTML files (downloaded previously)
html_files = [
    'PMC4863427.html',
    'PMC7223160.html',
    'PMC7264388.html',
]

results = []

for html_file in html_files:
    html_path = Path(html_file)
    if not html_path.exists():
        print(f"File not found: {html_file}")
        continue
    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')
    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')

    # Extract PMCID from filename
    pmcid = re.search(r'PMC\d+', html_file).group() if re.search(r'PMC\d+', html_file) else ''

    # Extract PMID from meta tag or text
    pmid = ''
    meta_pmid = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_pmid'})
    if meta_pmid:
        pmid = meta_pmid.get('content')
    else:
        # Try to find PMID in the text
        pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\s]+(\d+)', html_text)
        if pmid_match:
            pmid = pmid_match.group(1)

    # Extract keywords from meta tag or text
    keywords = ''
    meta_keywords = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_keywords'})
    if meta_keywords:
        keywords = meta_keywords.get('content')
    else:
        # Try to find keywords in the text
        kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\s]+([\w\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)
        if kw_match:
            keywords = kw_match.group(1).strip()

    # Extract all tables and search for X, Y, Z coordinates
    tables = soup.find_all('table')
    for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1):
        rows = table.find_all('tr')
        for row in rows:
            cols = [td.get_text(strip=True) for td in row.find_all(['td', 'th'])]
            # Look for rows with at least 3 numbers (potential X, Y, Z)
            nums = [float(x) for x in cols if re.match(r'^-?\d+(\.\d+)?$', x)]
            if len(nums) >= 3:
                # Take the first three as X, Y, Z
                x, y, z = nums[:3]
                results.append({
                    'PMID': pmid,
                    'PMCID': pmcid.replace('PMC',''),
                    'Keywords': keywords,
                    'Table': table_idx,
                    'X': x,
                    'Y': y,
                    'Z': z,
                })

# Save to CSV
df = pd.DataFrame(results)
df.to_csv('b11504006_info_data.csv', index=False)
print('Saved to b11504006_info_data.csv')

To reliably extract keywords, you should search for a section or heading labeled "Keywords" and then extract the text that follows it, not just use meta tags or a simple regex. The current code does not do this, so it often misses the keywords.

There are no keywords in your output because the code tries to extract keywords from a `<meta name="citation_keywords">` tag, which is often missing in PMC HTML. If that tag is not found, it tries to find keywords in the raw HTML text using a regex, but the actual keywords in PMC articles are usually inside a visible section labeled "Keywords" in the article body, not in a meta tag or a simple text line.

To reliably extract keywords, you should search for a section or heading labeled "Keywords" and then extract the text that follows it, not just use meta tags or a simple regex. The current code does not do this, so it often misses the keywords.

                "",

            "cell_type": "code",

            "metadata": {
                "language": "python"
            },
            "source": [
                "import pandas as pd",
                "df = pd.read_csv('info_data.csv')",
                "print(df.head())",
                "print(df['Keywords'][0])"
            ]
        },
        {
            "cell_type": "code",
            "id": "#VSC-d10f2b53",
            "metadata": {
                "language": "python"
            },
            "source": [
                "# Extract coordinates and metadata from the three PMC HTML files and save to CSV (only X, Y, Z columns)",
                "import re",
                "import pandas as pd",
                "from bs4 import BeautifulSoup",
                "from pathlib import Path",
                "",
                "# List of HTML files (downloaded previously)",
                "html_files = [",
                "    'PMC4863427.html',",
                "    'PMC7223160.html',",
                "    'PMC7264388.html',",
                "]",
                "",
                "results = []",
                "",
                "def extract_keywords(soup, html_text):",
                "    meta_keywords = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_keywords'})",
                "    if meta_keywords and meta_keywords.get('content'):",
                "        return meta_keywords.get('content')",
                "    for tag in soup.find_all(['b', 'strong', 'h3', 'h4', 'p', 'span']):",
                "        if tag.get_text(strip=True).lower().startswith('keywords'):",
                "            next_text = ''",
                "            text = tag.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True)",
                "            if ':' in text:",
                "                next_text = text.split(':', 1)[1].strip()",
                "            if not next_text:",
                "                sibling = tag.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if not next_text and tag.parent:",
                "                sibling = tag.parent.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if next_text:",
                "                return next_text",
                "    kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)",
                "    if kw_match:",
                "        return kw_match.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "for html_file in html_files:",
                "    html_path = Path(html_file)",
                "    if not html_path.exists():",
                "        print(f\"File not found: {html_file}\")",
                "        continue",
                "    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')",
                "    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')",
                "",
                "    pmcid = re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file).group() if re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file) else ''",
                "",
                "    pmid = ''",
                "    meta_pmid = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_pmid'})",
                "    if meta_pmid:",
                "        pmid = meta_pmid.get('content')",
                "    else:",
                "        pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\\s]+(\\d+)', html_text)",
                "        if pmid_match:",
                "            pmid = pmid_match.group(1)",
                "",
                "    keywords = extract_keywords(soup, html_text)",
                "",
                "    tables = soup.find_all('table')",
                "    for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1):",
                "        rows = table.find_all('tr')",
                "        if not rows:",
                "            continue",
                "        # Get header row and check for X, Y, Z columns (case-insensitive)",
                "        header = [th.get_text(strip=True).lower() for th in rows[0].find_all(['td', 'th'])]",
                "        if not (('x' in header and 'y' in header and 'z' in header)):",
                "            continue",
                "        # Get the indices for x, y, z columns",
                "        x_idx = header.index('x')",
                "        y_idx = header.index('y')",
                "        z_idx = header.index('z')",
                "        # Extract data rows",
                "        for row in rows[1:]:",
                "            cols = [td.get_text(strip=True) for td in row.find_all(['td', 'th'])]",
                "            try:",
                "                x = float(cols[x_idx])",
                "                y = float(cols[y_idx])",
                "                z = float(cols[z_idx])",
                "            except (IndexError, ValueError):",
                "                continue",
                "            results.append({",
                "                'PMID': pmid,",
                "                'PMCID': pmcid.replace('PMC',''),",
                "                'Keywords': keywords,",
                "                'Table': table_idx,",
                "                'X': x,",
                "                'Y': y,",
                "                'Z': z,",
                "            })",
                "",
                "df = pd.DataFrame(results)",
                "df.to_csv('b11504006_info_data.csv', index=False)",
                "print('Saved to b11504006_info_data.csv')"
            ]
        },
        {
            "cell_type": "code",
            "id": "#VSC-5b33d10c",
            "metadata": {
                "language": "python"
            },

                ""
            ]
        }
    ]
}

            "source": [
                "# Extract coordinates and metadata from the three PMC HTML files and save to CSV (only from tables with X, Y, Z headers, any order, case-insensitive)",
                "import re",
                "import pandas as pd",
                "from bs4 import BeautifulSoup",
                "from pathlib import Path",
                "",
                "# List of HTML files (downloaded previously)",
                "html_files = [",
                "    'PMC4863427.html',",
                "    'PMC7223160.html',",
                "    'PMC7264388.html',",
                "]",
                "",
                "results = []",
                "",
                "def extract_keywords(soup, html_text):",
                "    meta_keywords = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_keywords'})",
                "    if meta_keywords and meta_keywords.get('content'):",
                "        return meta_keywords.get('content')",
                "    for tag in soup.find_all(['b', 'strong', 'h3', 'h4', 'p', 'span']):",
                "        if tag.get_text(strip=True).lower().startswith('keywords'):",
                "            next_text = ''",
                "            text = tag.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True)",
                "            if ':' in text:",
                "                next_text = text.split(':', 1)[1].strip()",
                "            if not next_text:",
                "                sibling = tag.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if not next_text and tag.parent:",
                "                sibling = tag.parent.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if next_text:",
                "                return next_text",
                "    kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)",
                "    if kw_match:",
                "        return kw_match.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "for html_file in html_files:",
                "    html_path = Path(html_file)",
                "    if not html_path.exists():",
                "        print(f\"File not found: {html_file}\")",
                "        continue",
                "    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')",
                "    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')",
                "",
                "    pmcid = re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file).group() if re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file) else ''",
                "",
                "    pmid = ''",
                "    meta_pmid = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_pmid'})",
                "    if meta_pmid:",
                "        pmid = meta_pmid.get('content')",
                "    else:",
                "        pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\\s]+(\\d+)', html_text)",
                "        if pmid_match:",
                "            pmid = pmid_match.group(1)",
                "",
                "    keywords = extract_keywords(soup, html_text)",
                "",
                "    tables = soup.find_all('table')",
                "    for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1):",
                "        rows = table.find_all('tr')",
                "        if not rows:",
                "            continue",
                "        # Find header row (first row with th or first row if all td)",
                "        header_cells = [cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in rows[0].find_all(['th', 'td'])]",
                "        header_lower = [h.lower() for h in header_cells]",
                "        # Check if all of x, y, z are present in header (case-insensitive, any order)",
                "        xyz_headers = ['x', 'y', 'z']",
                "        if all(any(h == xyz for h in header_lower) for xyz in xyz_headers):",
                "            # Get the indices for x, y, z columns",
                "            x_idx = header_lower.index('x')",
                "            y_idx = header_lower.index('y')",
                "            z_idx = header_lower.index('z')",
                "            # Extract data rows (skip header)",
                "            for row in rows[1:]:",
                "                cols = [td.get_text(strip=True) for td in row.find_all(['td', 'th'])]",
                "                # Ensure enough columns",
                "                if len(cols) > max(x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "                    try:",
                "                        x = float(cols[x_idx])",
                "                        y = float(cols[y_idx])",
                "                        z = float(cols[z_idx])",
                "                        results.append({",
                "                            'PMID': pmid,",
                "                            'PMCID': pmcid.replace('PMC',''),",
                "                            'Keywords': keywords,",
                "                            'Table': table_idx,",
                "                            'X': x,",
                "                            'Y': y,",
                "                            'Z': z,",
                "                        })",
                "                    except ValueError:",
                "                        continue",
                "",
                "df = pd.DataFrame(results)",
                "df.to_csv('b11504006_info_data.csv', index=False)",
                "print('Saved to b11504006_info_data.csv')"
            ]

            "source": [
                "# Improved extraction: match X, Y, Z headers flexibly, allow negative/decimal values, extract all valid rows",
                "import re",
                "import pandas as pd",
                "from bs4 import BeautifulSoup",
                "from pathlib import Path",
                "",
                "html_files = [",
                "    'PMC4863427.html',",
                "    'PMC7223160.html',",
                "    'PMC7264388.html',",
                "]",
                "",
                "results = []",
                "",
                "def extract_keywords(soup, html_text):",
                "    meta_keywords = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_keywords'})",
                "    if meta_keywords and meta_keywords.get('content'):",
                "        return meta_keywords.get('content')",
                "    for tag in soup.find_all(['b', 'strong', 'h3', 'h4', 'p', 'span']):",
                "        if tag.get_text(strip=True).lower().startswith('keywords'):",
                "            next_text = ''",
                "            text = tag.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True)",
                "            if ':' in text:",
                "                next_text = text.split(':', 1)[1].strip()",
                "            if not next_text:",
                "                sibling = tag.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if not next_text and tag.parent:",
                "                sibling = tag.parent.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if next_text:",
                "                return next_text",
                "    kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)",
                "    if kw_match:",
                "        return kw_match.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "# Regex for flexible header matching (e.g., 'X', 'X (mm)', 'x-coord', etc.)",
                "def find_xyz_indices(header_cells):",
                "    x_idx = y_idx = z_idx = None",
                "    for i, h in enumerate(header_cells):",
                "        h_clean = h.strip().lower()",
                "        if re.match(r'^x(\\b|[^a-zA-Z])', h_clean) and x_idx is None:",
                "            x_idx = i",
                "        elif re.match(r'^y(\\b|[^a-zA-Z])', h_clean) and y_idx is None:",
                "            y_idx = i",
                "        elif re.match(r'^z(\\b|[^a-zA-Z])', h_clean) and z_idx is None:",
                "            z_idx = i",
                "    if None not in (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "        return x_idx, y_idx, z_idx",
                "    return None",
                "",
                "for html_file in html_files:",
                "    html_path = Path(html_file)",
                "    if not html_path.exists():",
                "        print(f\"File not found: {html_file}\")",
                "        continue",
                "    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')",
                "    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')",
                "",
                "    pmcid = re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file).group() if re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file) else ''",
                "",
                "    pmid = ''",
                "    meta_pmid = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_pmid'})",
                "    if meta_pmid:",
                "        pmid = meta_pmid.get('content')",
                "    else:",
                "        pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\\s]+(\\d+)', html_text)",
                "        if pmid_match:",
                "            pmid = pmid_match.group(1)",
                "",
                "    keywords = extract_keywords(soup, html_text)",
                "",
                "    tables = soup.find_all('table')",
                "    for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1):",
                "        rows = table.find_all('tr')",
                "        if not rows:",
                "            continue",
                "        header_cells = [cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in rows[0].find_all(['th', 'td'])]",
                "        xyz_indices = find_xyz_indices(header_cells)",
                "        if xyz_indices:",
                "            x_idx, y_idx, z_idx = xyz_indices",
                "            for row in rows[1:]:",
                "                cols = [td.get_text(strip=True) for td in row.find_all(['td', 'th'])]",
                "                if len(cols) > max(x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "                    try:",
                "                        x = float(cols[x_idx])",
                "                        y = float(cols[y_idx])",
                "                        z = float(cols[z_idx])",
                "                        results.append({",
                "                            'PMID': pmid,",
                "                            'PMCID': pmcid.replace('PMC',''),",
                "                            'Keywords': keywords,",
                "                            'Table': table_idx,",
                "                            'X': x,",
                "                            'Y': y,",
                "                            'Z': z,",
                "                        })",
                "                    except ValueError:",
                "                        continue",
                "",
                "df = pd.DataFrame(results)",
                "df.to_csv('b11504006_info_data.csv', index=False)",
                "print('Saved to b11504006_info_data.csv')"
            ]

                "def extract_keywords(soup, html_text):",

                "    if meta_keywords and meta_keywords.get('content'):",
                "        return meta_keywords.get('content')",
                "    for tag in soup.find_all(['b', 'strong', 'h3', 'h4', 'p', 'span']):",
                "        if tag.get_text(strip=True).lower().startswith('keywords'):",
                "            next_text = ''",
                "            text = tag.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True)",
                "            if ':' in text:",
                "                next_text = text.split(':', 1)[1].strip()",
                "            if not next_text:",
                "                sibling = tag.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if not next_text and tag.parent:",
                "                sibling = tag.parent.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",

                "            if next_text:",
                "                return next_text",
                "    kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)",

                "        return kw_match.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "# More robust header matching: allow 'x', 'X', 'TalX', 'X (mm)', etc.",
                "def find_xyz_indices(header_cells):",
                "    x_idx = y_idx = z_idx = None",
                "    for i, h in enumerate(header_cells):",
                "        h_clean = h.strip().lower()",
                "        if x_idx is None and re.search(r'(\\bx\\b|talx|x[^a-zA-Z0-9]|[^a-zA-Z0-9]x|x\\s|\\sx\\b)', h_clean):",
                "            x_idx = i",
                "        elif y_idx is None and re.search(r'(\\by\\b|taly|y[^a-zA-Z0-9]|[^a-zA-Z0-9]y|y\\s|\\sy\\b)', h_clean):",
                "            y_idx = i",
                "        elif z_idx is None and re.search(r'(\\bz\\b|talz|z[^a-zA-Z0-9]|[^a-zA-Z0-9]z|z\\s|\\sz\\b)', h_clean):",
                "            z_idx = i",
                "    if None not in (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "        return x_idx, y_idx, z_idx",
                "    return None",
                "",
                "def is_number(val):",
                "    try:",
                "        float(val)",
                "        return True",
                "    except Exception:",
                "        return False",
                "",
                "for html_file in html_files:",
                "    html_path = Path(html_file)",
                "    if not html_path.exists():",
                "        print(f\"File not found: {html_file}\")",
                "        continue",
                "    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')",
                "    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')",

                "        rows = table.find_all('tr')",
                "        if not rows:",

                "        header_cells = [cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in rows[0].find_all(['th', 'td'])]",

response.value:
To save the three PMC article URLs as PDF files, you need to render the web pages and print them to PDF. This is best done using a headless browser like `pyppeteer` or `selenium` (since requests alone cannot render HTML to PDF).

I'll provide a code cell that uses `pyppeteer` to download each URL and save it as a PDF file.

cells.source:
# Save each PMC article URL as a PDF using pyppeteer (headless Chrome)
import asyncio
from pyppeteer import launch

urls = [
    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427",
    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7223160",
    "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7264388",
]

async def save_urls_to_pdf(urls):
    browser = await launch(headless=True, args=['--no-sandbox'])
    for url in urls:
        page = await browser.newPage()
        await page.goto(url, {'waitUntil': 'networkidle2'})
        pmcid = url.split("/")[-1]
        pdf_path = f"{pmcid}.pdf"
        await page.pdf({'path': pdf_path, 'format': 'A4'})
        print(f"Saved {pdf_path}")
        await page.close()
    await browser.close()

# Run the async function
asyncio.get_event_loop().run_until_complete(save_urls_to_pdf(urls))

                "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427",

                "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7264388",
                "",
                "You can assume you know what tables to extract, IF NEEDED. ",
                "",
                "The sprint goal is to generate info_data.csv BY YOURSELF."
            ]
        },
        {
            "cell_type": "code",
            "id": "#VSC-25fd58ee",
            "metadata": {
                "language": "python"
            },
            "source": [
                "import pandas as pd",
                "df = pd.read_csv('info_data.csv')",
                "print(df.head())",
                "print(df['Keywords'][0])"
            ]
        },
        {
            "cell_type": "code",
            "id": "#VSC-dea5112c",
            "metadata": {
                "language": "python"
            },
            "source": [
                "# Extraction handles multi-row headers (e.g., 'Coordinates' with x, y, z underneath), flattens headers, and extracts correct columns",
                "import re",
                "import pandas as pd",
                "from bs4 import BeautifulSoup",
                "from pathlib import Path",
                "",
                "html_files = [",
                "    'PMC4863427.html',",
                "    'PMC7223160.html',",
                "    'PMC7264388.html',",
                "]",
                "",
                "results = []",
                "",
                "def extract_keywords(soup, html_text):",
                "    meta_keywords = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_keywords'})",
                "    if meta_keywords and meta_keywords.get('content'):",
                "        return meta_keywords.get('content')",
                "    for tag in soup.find_all(['b', 'strong', 'h3', 'h4', 'p', 'span']):",
                "        if tag.get_text(strip=True).lower().startswith('keywords'):",
                "            next_text = ''",
                "            text = tag.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True)",
                "            if ':' in text:",
                "                next_text = text.split(':', 1)[1].strip()",
                "            if not next_text:",
                "                sibling = tag.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if not next_text and tag.parent:",
                "                sibling = tag.parent.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if next_text:",
                "                return next_text",
                "    kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)",
                "    if kw_match:",
                "        return kw_match.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "def is_number(val):",
                "    try:",
                "        float(val)",
                "        return True",
                "    except Exception:",
                "        return False",
                "",
                "def find_xyz_indices_from_multiline_header(header_rows):",
                "    # Flatten multi-row headers: combine each column's header parts with space",
                "    n_cols = max(len(row) for row in header_rows)",
                "    flat_headers = [''] * n_cols",
                "    for row in header_rows:",
                "        for i in range(n_cols):",
                "            part = row[i].strip().lower() if i < len(row) else ''",
                "            if part:",
                "                if flat_headers[i]:",
                "                    flat_headers[i] += ' ' + part",
                "                else:",
                "                    flat_headers[i] = part",
                "    # Now look for x, y, z columns (allow e.g. 'coordinates x', 'x', etc.)",
                "    x_idx = y_idx = z_idx = None",
                "    for i, h in enumerate(flat_headers):",
                "        if x_idx is None and re.search(r'\\bx\\b', h):",
                "            x_idx = i",
                "        elif y_idx is None and re.search(r'\\by\\b', h):",
                "            y_idx = i",
                "        elif z_idx is None and re.search(r'\\bz\\b', h):",
                "            z_idx = i",
                "    if None not in (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "        return x_idx, y_idx, z_idx",
                "    return None",
                "",
                "for html_file in html_files:",
                "    html_path = Path(html_file)",
                "    if not html_path.exists():",
                "        print(f\"File not found: {html_file}\")",
                "        continue",
                "    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')",
                "    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')",
                "",
                "    pmcid = re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file).group() if re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file) else ''",
                "",
                "    pmid = ''",
                "    meta_pmid = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_pmid'})",
                "    if meta_pmid:",
                "        pmid = meta_pmid.get('content')",
                "    else:",
                "        pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\\s]+(\\d+)', html_text)",
                "        if pmid_match:",
                "            pmid = pmid_match.group(1)",
                "",
                "    keywords = extract_keywords(soup, html_text)",
                "",
                "    tables = soup.find_all('table')",
                "    for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1):",
                "        rows = table.find_all('tr')",
                "        if not rows:",
                "            continue",
                "        # Collect header rows (rows with only th, or first 2 rows if both have th)",
                "        header_rows = []",
                "        for row in rows[:2]:",
                "            cells = row.find_all(['th', 'td'])",
                "            if all(cell.name == 'th' for cell in cells):",
                "                header_rows.append([cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in cells])",
                "        if not header_rows:",
                "            # fallback: use first row as header",
                "            header_rows = [[cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in rows[0].find_all(['th', 'td'])]]",
                "        xyz_indices = find_xyz_indices_from_multiline_header(header_rows)",
                "        if xyz_indices:",
                "            x_idx, y_idx, z_idx = xyz_indices",
                "            # Data rows: skip header rows",
                "            for row in rows[len(header_rows):]:",
                "                cols = [td.get_text(strip=True) for td in row.find_all(['td', 'th'])]",
                "                if len(cols) > max(x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "                    x_val, y_val, z_val = cols[x_idx], cols[y_idx], cols[z_idx]",
                "                    if all(is_number(v) for v in [x_val, y_val, z_val]):",
                "                        x = float(x_val)",
                "                        y = float(y_val)",
                "                        z = float(z_val)",
                "                        results.append({",
                "                            'PMID': pmid,",
                "                            'PMCID': pmcid.replace('PMC',''),",
                "                            'Keywords': keywords,",
                "                            'Table': table_idx,",
                "                            'X': x,",
                "                            'Y': y,",
                "                            'Z': z,",
                "                        })",
                "",
                "df = pd.DataFrame(results)",
                "df.to_csv('b11504006_info_data.csv', index=False)",
                "print('Saved to b11504006_info_data.csv')"
            ]
        },

}

            "source": [
                "# Write your own [X, Y, Z] coordinate extractor",
                "You can either extract the coordinates from *.html or *.pdf of the 3 target articles:",
                "",
                "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC4863427",
                "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7223160",
                "https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC7264388",
                "",
                "You can assume you know what tables to extract, IF NEEDED. ",
                "",
                "The sprint goal is to generate info_data.csv BY YOURSELF."
            ]
        },
        {
            "cell_type": "code",
            "id": "#VSC-25fd58ee",
            "metadata": {
                "language": "python"
            },
            "source": [
                "import pandas as pd",
                "df = pd.read_csv('info_data.csv')",
                "print(df.head())",
                "print(df['Keywords'][0])"
            ]
        },
        {
            "cell_type": "code",
            "id": "#VSC-dea5112c",
            "metadata": {
                "language": "python"
            },
            "source": [
                "# Extraction handles multi-row headers (e.g., 'Coordinates' with x, y, z underneath), flattens headers, and extracts correct columns",
                "import re",
                "import pandas as pd",
                "from bs4 import BeautifulSoup",
                "from pathlib import Path",
                "",
                "html_files = [",
                "    'PMC4863427.html',",
                "    'PMC7223160.html',",
                "    'PMC7264388.html',",
                "]",
                "",
                "results = []",
                "",
                "def extract_keywords(soup, html_text):",
                "    meta_keywords = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_keywords'})",
                "    if meta_keywords and meta_keywords.get('content'):",
                "        return meta_keywords.get('content')",
                "    for tag in soup.find_all(['b', 'strong', 'h3', 'h4', 'p', 'span']):",
                "        if tag.get_text(strip=True).lower().startswith('keywords'):",
                "            next_text = ''",
                "            text = tag.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True)",
                "            if ':' in text:",
                "                next_text = text.split(':', 1)[1].strip()",
                "            if not next_text:",
                "                sibling = tag.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if not next_text and tag.parent:",
                "                sibling = tag.parent.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if next_text:",
                "                return next_text",
                "    kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)",
                "    if kw_match:",
                "        return kw_match.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "def is_number(val):",
                "    try:",
                "        float(val)",
                "        return True",
                "    except Exception:",
                "        return False",
                "",
                "def find_xyz_indices_from_multiline_header(header_rows):",
                "    # Flatten multi-row headers: combine each column's header parts with space",
                "    n_cols = max(len(row) for row in header_rows)",
                "    flat_headers = [''] * n_cols",
                "    for row in header_rows:",
                "        for i in range(n_cols):",
                "            part = row[i].strip().lower() if i < len(row) else ''",
                "            if part:",
                "                if flat_headers[i]:",
                "                    flat_headers[i] += ' ' + part",
                "                else:",
                "                    flat_headers[i] = part",
                "    # Now look for x, y, z columns (allow e.g. 'coordinates x', 'x', etc.)",
                "    x_idx = y_idx = z_idx = None",
                "    for i, h in enumerate(flat_headers):",
                "        if x_idx is None and re.search(r'\\bx\\b', h):",
                "            x_idx = i",
                "        elif y_idx is None and re.search(r'\\by\\b', h):",
                "            y_idx = i",
                "        elif z_idx is None and re.search(r'\\bz\\b', h):",
                "            z_idx = i",
                "    if None not in (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "        return x_idx, y_idx, z_idx",
                "    return None",
                "",
                "for html_file in html_files:",
                "    html_path = Path(html_file)",
                "    if not html_path.exists():",
                "        print(f\"File not found: {html_file}\")",
                "        continue",
                "    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')",
                "    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')",
                "",
                "    pmcid = re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file).group() if re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file) else ''",
                "",
                "    pmid = ''",
                "    meta_pmid = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_pmid'})",
                "    if meta_pmid:",
                "        pmid = meta_pmid.get('content')",
                "    else:",
                "        pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\\s]+(\\d+)', html_text)",
                "        if pmid_match:",
                "            pmid = pmid_match.group(1)",
                "",
                "    keywords = extract_keywords(soup, html_text)",
                "",
                "    tables = soup.find_all('table')",
                "    for table_idx, table in enumerate(tables, 1):",
                "        rows = table.find_all('tr')",
                "        if not rows:",
                "            continue",
                "        # Collect header rows (rows with only th, or first 2 rows if both have th)",
                "        header_rows = []",
                "        for row in rows[:2]:",
                "            cells = row.find_all(['th', 'td'])",
                "            if all(cell.name == 'th' for cell in cells):",
                "                header_rows.append([cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in cells])",
                "        if not header_rows:",
                "            # fallback: use first row as header",
                "            header_rows = [[cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in rows[0].find_all(['th', 'td'])]]",
                "        xyz_indices = find_xyz_indices_from_multiline_header(header_rows)",
                "        if xyz_indices:",
                "            x_idx, y_idx, z_idx = xyz_indices",
                "            # Data rows: skip header rows",
                "            for row in rows[len(header_rows):]:",
                "                cols = [td.get_text(strip=True) for td in row.find_all(['td', 'th'])]",
                "                if len(cols) > max(x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "                    x_val, y_val, z_val = cols[x_idx], cols[y_idx], cols[z_idx]",
                "                    if all(is_number(v) for v in [x_val, y_val, z_val]):",
                "                        x = float(x_val)",
                "                        y = float(y_val)",
                "                        z = float(z_val)",
                "                        results.append({",
                "                            'PMID': pmid,",
                "                            'PMCID': pmcid.replace('PMC',''),",
                "                            'Keywords': keywords,",
                "                            'Table': table_idx,",
                "                            'X': x,",
                "                            'Y': y,",
                "                            'Z': z,",
                "                        })",
                "",
                "df = pd.DataFrame(results)",
                "df.to_csv('b11504006_info_data.csv', index=False)",
                "print('Saved to b11504006_info_data.csv')"
            ]
        },

response.value:
The warning means that if your `Path` variable (an environment variable in Windows) contains `;` or `;;` in an unexpected way, it can cause issues for some extensions or tools, especially those that parse the `Path` variable to find executables.

**What to do:**
- Open a terminal and run:
  ```powershell
  echo $env:Path
  ```
- If you see any `;;` (double semicolons) or stray semicolons at the start/end, you should remove them.
- You can edit your system/user environment variables via:
  - Windows Search → "Edit the system environment variables" → "Environment Variables..." → Edit the `Path` variable for your user or system.

**Why it matters:**  
Each path in the `Path` variable should be separated by a single `;`. Extra or misplaced semicolons can make some programs or extensions fail to load or find dependencies.

If you need step-by-step help cleaning your `Path`, let me know!

The warning means that if your `Path` variable (an environment variable in Windows) contains `;` or `;;` in an unexpected way, it can cause issues for some extensions or tools, especially those that parse the `Path` variable to find executables.

**What to do:**
- Open a terminal and run:
  ```powershell
  echo $env:Path
  ```
- If you see any `;;` (double semicolons) or stray semicolons at the start/end, you should remove them.
- You can edit your system/user environment variables via:
  - Windows Search → "Edit the system environment variables" → "Environment Variables..." → Edit the `Path` variable for your user or system.

**Why it matters:**  
Each path in the `Path` variable should be separated by a single `;`. Extra or misplaced semicolons can make some programs or extensions fail to load or find dependencies.

If you need step-by-step help cleaning your `Path`, let me know!

response.value:
You cannot "uninstall" or "reinstall" the Windows system `Path` variable itself, but you can safely edit or reset its contents. If you want to clean up your `Path` variable (for example, to remove duplicate, broken, or problematic entries), you can do so through the Windows environment variable editor.

**How to reset or clean your Path variable:**

1. Press `Win + S` and search for "Environment Variables".
2. Click "Edit the system environment variables".
3. In the System Properties window, click "Environment Variables...".
4. In the "User variables" or "System variables" section, find and select `Path`, then click "Edit".
5. Review the list:
   - Remove any empty entries, duplicate entries, or entries with just `;` or `;;`.
   - Make sure each path is valid and points to an actual folder.
6. Click OK to save.

**If you want to reset to Windows defaults:**
- There is no "reinstall" for Path, but you can manually remove all custom entries and add only the default Windows paths (like

, etc.).

**If you want to do this with a script:**
- You can use PowerShell to view or set the Path, but manual editing is safest for most users.

If you want a PowerShell script to back up, clear, or reset your Path variable, let me know!

{"filePath":"c:\Users\USER\github-classroom\ntu-info\neurosynth-etl-11rachelh\extract_pdf_coordinates.py","content":"import os
import re
import pandas as pd
from pathlib import Path
from PyPDF2 import PdfReader

# Directory containing the PDFs
pdf_dir = Path(r"C:\Users\USER\Desktop\NTU\三上\心理與神經資訊\crawler")
pdf_files = [f for f in pdf_dir.glob('*.pdf')][:3]  # Only first 3 PDFs

results = []

# Helper: extract keywords from text
KEYWORDS_PATTERNS = [r'Keywords?[:\s]+([\w\s;,-]+)', r'KEY WORDS?[:\s]+([\w\s;,-]+)']
def extract_keywords(text):
    for pat in KEYWORDS_PATTERNS:
        m = re.search(pat, text, re.IGNORECASE)
        if m:
            return m.group(1).strip()
    return ''

def extract_pmid_pmcid(text):
    pmid = ''
    pmcid = ''
    pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\s]*([0-9]+)', text)
    pmcid_match = re.search(r'PMCID[:\s]*PMC([0-9]+)', text)
    if pmid_match:
        pmid = pmid_match.group(1)
    if pmcid_match:
        pmcid = pmcid_match.group(1)
    return pmid, pmcid

def extract_xyz_from_lines(lines):
    xyz_indices = None
    header_row = None
    for i, line in enumerate(lines):
        # Try to find header row with x/y/z
        if re.search(r'\bx\b', line, re.IGNORECASE) and re.search(r'\by\b', line, re.IGNORECASE) and re.search(r'\bz\b', line, re.IGNORECASE):
            header_row = i
            headers = re.split(r'\s{2,}|\t|,', line)
            header_map = {h.strip().lower(): idx for idx, h in enumerate(headers)}
            # Find indices for x, y, z
            x_idx = y_idx = z_idx = None
            for idx, h in enumerate(headers):
                h_l = h.strip().lower()
                if h_l == 'x': x_idx = idx
                if h_l == 'y': y_idx = idx
                if h_l == 'z': z_idx = idx
            if None not in (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):
                xyz_indices = (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx)
                break
    if xyz_indices is None:
        return []
    # Extract data rows
    coords = []
    for line in lines[header_row+1:]:
        cols = re.split(r'\s{2,}|\t|,', line)
        if len(cols) > max(xyz_indices):
            try:
                x = float(cols[xyz_indices[0]])
                y = float(cols[xyz_indices[1]])
                z = float(cols[xyz_indices[2]])
                coords.append((x, y, z))
            except Exception:
                continue
    return coords

for pdf_path in pdf_files:
    reader = PdfReader(str(pdf_path))
    full_text = "\n".join(page.extract_text() or '' for page in reader.pages)
    pmid, pmcid = extract_pmid_pmcid(full_text)
    keywords = extract_keywords(full_text)
    # Try to find all tables with x/y/z
    lines = full_text.splitlines()
    table_num = 0
    for i, line in enumerate(lines):
        if re.search(r'\bx\b', line, re.IGNORECASE) and re.search(r'\by\b', line, re.IGNORECASE) and re.search(r'\bz\b', line, re.IGNORECASE):
            table_num += 1
            coords = extract_xyz_from_lines(lines[i:i+20])  # look ahead 20 lines
            for x, y, z in coords:
                results.append({
                    'PMID': pmid,
                    'PMCID': pmcid,
                    'Keywords': keywords,
                    'Table': table_num,
                    'X': x,
                    'Y': y,
                    'Z': z,
                })

# Save to CSV
df = pd.DataFrame(results)
df.to_csv('b11504006_data.csv', index=False)
print('Saved to b11504006_data.csv')
"}

                "# Extraction handles multi-row headers (e.g., 'Coordinates' with x, y, z underneath), flattens headers, and extracts correct columns",
                "import re",
                "import pandas as pd",
                "from bs4 import BeautifulSoup",
                "from pathlib import Path",

                "def extract_keywords(soup, html_text):",
                "    meta_keywords = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_keywords'})",
                "    if meta_keywords and meta_keywords.get('content'):",
                "        return meta_keywords.get('content')",
                "    for tag in soup.find_all(['b', 'strong', 'h3', 'h4', 'p', 'span']):",
                "        if tag.get_text(strip=True).lower().startswith('keywords'):",
                "            next_text = ''",
                "            text = tag.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True)",
                "            if ':' in text:",
                "                next_text = text.split(':', 1)[1].strip()",
                "            if not next_text:",
                "                sibling = tag.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if not next_text and tag.parent:",
                "                sibling = tag.parent.find_next_sibling(text=True)",
                "                if sibling:",
                "                    next_text = sibling.strip()",
                "            if next_text:",
                "                return next_text",
                "    kw_match = re.search(r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', html_text, re.IGNORECASE)",
                "    if kw_match:",
                "        return kw_match.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "def is_number(val):",
                "    try:",
                "        float(val)",
                "        return True",
                "    except Exception:",
                "        return False",
                "",
                "def find_xyz_indices_from_multiline_header(header_rows):",
                "    # Flatten multi-row headers: combine each column's header parts with space",
                "    n_cols = max(len(row) for row in header_rows)",
                "    flat_headers = [''] * n_cols",
                "    for row in header_rows:",
                "        for i in range(n_cols):",
                "            part = row[i].strip().lower() if i < len(row) else ''",
                "            if part:",
                "                if flat_headers[i]:",
                "                    flat_headers[i] += ' ' + part",
                "                else:",
                "                    flat_headers[i] = part",
                "    # Now look for x, y, z columns (allow e.g. 'coordinates x', 'x', etc.)",
                "    x_idx = y_idx = z_idx = None",
                "    for i, h in enumerate(flat_headers):",
                "        if x_idx is None and re.search(r'\\bx\\b', h):",
                "            x_idx = i",
                "        elif y_idx is None and re.search(r'\\by\\b', h):",
                "            y_idx = i",
                "        elif z_idx is None and re.search(r'\\bz\\b', h):",
                "            z_idx = i",
                "    if None not in (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "        return x_idx, y_idx, z_idx",
                "    return None",
                "",
                "for html_file in html_files:",
                "    html_path = Path(html_file)",
                "    if not html_path.exists():",
                "        print(f\"File not found: {html_file}\")",
                "        continue",
                "    html_text = html_path.read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')",
                "    soup = BeautifulSoup(html_text, 'html.parser')",
                "",
                "    pmcid = re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file).group() if re.search(r'PMC\\d+', html_file) else ''",
                "",
                "    pmid = ''",
                "    meta_pmid = soup.find('meta', attrs={'name': 'citation_pmid'})",
                "    if meta_pmid:",
                "        pmid = meta_pmid.get('content')",
                "    else:",
                "        pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\\s]+(\\d+)', html_text)",

                "    keywords = extract_keywords(soup, html_text)",

                "            continue",
                "        # Collect header rows (rows with only th, or first 2 rows if both have th)",
                "        header_rows = []",
                "        for row in rows[:2]:",
                "            cells = row.find_all(['th', 'td'])",
                "            if all(cell.name == 'th' for cell in cells):",
                "                header_rows.append([cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in cells])",
                "        if not header_rows:",
                "            # fallback: use first row as header",
                "            header_rows = [[cell.get_text(strip=True) for cell in rows[0].find_all(['th', 'td'])]]",
                "        xyz_indices = find_xyz_indices_from_multiline_header(header_rows)",
                "        if xyz_indices:",
                "            x_idx, y_idx, z_idx = xyz_indices",
                "            # Data rows: skip header rows",

                "                if len(cols) > max(x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",

                "                        y = float(y_val)",
                "                        z = float(z_val)",
                "                        results.append({",
                "                            'PMID': pmid,",
                "                            'PMCID': pmcid.replace('PMC',''),",
                "                            'Keywords': keywords,",
                "                            'Table': table_idx,",
                "                            'X': x,",
                "                            'Y': y,",
                "                            'Z': z,",
                "                        })",
                "",
                "df = pd.DataFrame(results)",
                "df.to_csv('b11504006_info_data.csv', index=False)",
                "print('Saved to b11504006_info_data.csv')"

                "import os",
                "import re",
                "import pandas as pd",
                "from pathlib import Path",
                "from PyPDF2 import PdfReader",
                "",
                "# Directory containing the PDFs",
                "pdf_dir = Path(r\"C:\\Users\\USER\\Desktop\\NTU\\三上\\心理與神經資訊\\crawler\")",
                "pdf_files = [f for f in pdf_dir.glob('*.pdf')][:3]  # Only first 3 PDFs",
                "",
                "results = []",
                "",
                "# Helper: extract keywords from text",
                "KEYWORDS_PATTERNS = [r'Keywords?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)', r'KEY WORDS?[:\\s]+([\\w\\s;,-]+)']",
                "def extract_keywords(text):",
                "    for pat in KEYWORDS_PATTERNS:",
                "        m = re.search(pat, text, re.IGNORECASE)",
                "        if m:",
                "            return m.group(1).strip()",
                "    return ''",
                "",
                "def extract_pmid_pmcid(text):",
                "    pmid = ''",
                "    pmcid = ''",
                "    pmid_match = re.search(r'PMID[:\\s]*([0-9]+)', text)",
                "    pmcid_match = re.search(r'PMCID[:\\s]*PMC([0-9]+)', text)",
                "    if pmid_match:",
                "        pmid = pmid_match.group(1)",
                "    if pmcid_match:",
                "        pmcid = pmcid_match.group(1)",
                "    return pmid, pmcid",
                "",
                "def extract_xyz_from_lines(lines):",
                "    xyz_indices = None",
                "    header_row = None",
                "    for i, line in enumerate(lines):",
                "        # Try to find header row with x/y/z",
                "        if re.search(r'\\bx\\b', line, re.IGNORECASE) and re.search(r'\\by\\b', line, re.IGNORECASE) and re.search(r'\\bz\\b', line, re.IGNORECASE):",
                "            header_row = i",
                "            headers = re.split(r'\\s{2,}|\\t|,', line)",
                "            header_map = {h.strip().lower(): idx for idx, h in enumerate(headers)}",
                "            # Find indices for x, y, z",
                "            x_idx = y_idx = z_idx = None",
                "            for idx, h in enumerate(headers):",
                "                h_l = h.strip().lower()",
                "                if h_l == 'x': x_idx = idx",
                "                if h_l == 'y': y_idx = idx",
                "                if h_l == 'z': z_idx = idx",
                "            if None not in (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx):",
                "                xyz_indices = (x_idx, y_idx, z_idx)",
                "                break",
                "    if xyz_indices is None:",
                "        return []",
                "    # Extract data rows",
                "    coords = []",
                "    for line in lines[header_row+1:]:",
                "        cols = re.split(r'\\s{2,}|\\t|,', line)",
                "        if len(cols) > max(xyz_indices):",
                "            try:",
                "                x = float(cols[xyz_indices[0]])",
